cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles ENE of Daytona Beach, FL
cyclone.trajectory: moving NNW today along the northeast Florida and Georgia coasts, turning north tonight and tracking parallel to/near the South Carolina coast Saturday, then skirting the southeastern North Carolina coast late Saturday before curving seaward Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the South Carolina coast (around Charleston–Cape Romain)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cocoa Beach, FL to Surf City, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from central Florida through Georgia and South Carolina to Cape Fear–Surf City, NC
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely, with a 33% peak chance of 34-kt winds and up to a 20% chance of 50-kt winds; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core remains close to the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC guidance shows 4–6 ft of inundation possible from Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Fear, NC, which includes Wilmington and the lower Cape Fear River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with locally higher totals up to 15 inches possible, creating a high risk of urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, and prolonged rough seas will hamper port operations and vessel traffic.
